name: Endive
properties: Member of the chicory family (related to escarole and radicchio)
Bitter leafy green with distinctive flavor
Rich in vitamins A, C, and K
Can be eaten raw or cooked
benefits: Supports digestive health with high fiber content
Provides antioxidants that combat free radicals
Contains bitter compounds that may aid digestion
Supports bone health with vitamin K
May help regulate blood sugar levels
Aids in weight management with low calorie density
synergies: Pairs well with white beans (cannellini) in Italian dishes
Combines with garlic for enhanced flavor and benefits
Works with other bitter greens (radicchio, escarole)

quotes: A member of the chicory family, escarole is a hearty bitter green widely used in Italian cooking and is frequently paired with cannellini beans. Endive or chicory would also taste good.

ARE PRE-CUT VEGETABLES JUST AS HEALTHY? - Endotoxins come from bacteria, such as E. coli. Most spoilage organisms cannot penetrate the surface barrier of plants to spoil the inner tissues, but once you cut them open, bacteria can gain access and vegetables can start to spoil in a matter of days.
